snippet: The automaker said 8.4 million vehicles worldwide were being recalled, bringing its total for the year to more than 29 million.
abstract: News analysis; announcement that General Motors will recall another 8.4 million vehicles for range of defects appears to be direct result of company's newfound vigilance to rooting out safety issues; even as GM addresses its safety shortcomings, spiraling number of new recalls is threatening to undermine its reputation for safety.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and DANIELLE IVORY
byline.contributor: Bill Vlasic reported from Detroit and Danielle Ivory from New York.

lead_paragraph: The automaker said 8.4 million vehicles worldwide were being recalled, bringing its total for the year to more than 29 million.

headline.main: In Recall Blitz, G.M. Risks Its Reputation
headline.print_headline: In Recall Blitz, G.M. Risks Its Reputation
